page.title: 14MORDIFORD DRAINAGE BASIN
page.content: Mordiford is situated at the fork formed by the confluence of the Rivers Wye and Lugg. The surrounding area in winter suffers from severe flooding. Along one stretch of the river the farmers have allowed a bank to be built by the Welsh Water Authority. The Levee follows the river's course from Hampton Bishop to Mordiford and up the Lugg. This protects some of the surrounding fields and houses from the worst effects of winter flooding. The river has advantages and disadvantages for farmers: 1.many of the fields are regularly covered in a layer of fertile silt but 2. the flooding often results in the loss of winter crops and damage to fields, hedges and livestock etc.
